metadata.title: CVE-2016-5706 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
js/get_scripts.js.php in phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.16, 4.4.x before4.4.15.7, and 4.6.x before 4.6.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service via a large array in the scripts parameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5706` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.3-1').
